trans-unit.source: Use Apache Phoenix and SQuirreL in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Use Apache Phoenix and SQuirreL in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Apache Phoenix in HDInsight, and how to install and configure SQuirreL on your workstation to connect to an HBase cluster in HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Apache Phoenix in HDInsight, and how to install and configure SQuirreL on your workstation to connect to an HBase cluster in HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use <linkText>Apache Phoenix</linkText><title></title> in HDInsight, and how to install and configure SQuirreL on your workstation to connect to an HBase cluster in HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use <linkText>Apache Phoenix</linkText><title></title> in HDInsight, and how to install and configure SQuirreL on your workstation to connect to an HBase cluster in HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: For more information about Phoenix, see <linkText>Phoenix in 15 minutes or less</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about Phoenix, see <linkText>Phoenix in 15 minutes or less</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For the Phoenix grammar, see <linkText>Phoenix Grammar</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For the Phoenix grammar, see <linkText>Phoenix Grammar</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For the Phoenix version information in HDInsight, see <linkText>What's new in the Hadoop cluster versions provided by HDInsight?[hdinsight-versions]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For the Phoenix version information in HDInsight, see <linkText>What's new in the Hadoop cluster versions provided by HDInsight?[hdinsight-versions]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SQLLine</linkText><title></title> is a command line utility to execute SQL.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SQLLine</linkText><title></title> is a command line utility to execute SQL.

trans-unit.source: Before you can use SQLLine, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you can use SQLLine, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: A HBase cluster in HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: A HBase cluster in HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: For information on provision HBase cluster, see <linkText>Get started with Apache HBase in HDInsight[hdinsight-hbase-get-started]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For information on provision HBase cluster, see <linkText>Get started with Apache HBase in HDInsight[hdinsight-hbase-get-started]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Connect to the HBase cluster via the remote desktop protocol.
trans-unit.target: Connect to the HBase cluster via the remote desktop protocol.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see <linkText>Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight by using the Azure portal[hdinsight-manage-portal]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see <linkText>Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight by using the Azure portal[hdinsight-manage-portal]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To find out the host name
trans-unit.target: To find out the host name

trans-unit.source: Open Hadoop Command Line from the desktop.
trans-unit.target: Open Hadoop Command Line from the desktop.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to get the DNS suffix:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to get the DNS suffix:

trans-unit.source: Write down Connection-specific DNS Suffix.
trans-unit.target: Write down Connection-specific DNS Suffix.

trans-unit.source: For example, myhbasecluster.f5.internal.cloudapp.net.
trans-unit.target: For example, myhbasecluster.f5.internal.cloudapp.net.

trans-unit.source: When you connect to an HBase cluster, you will need to connect to one of the Zookeepers using FQDN.
trans-unit.target: When you connect to an HBase cluster, you will need to connect to one of the Zookeepers using FQDN.

trans-unit.source: Each HDInsight cluster has 3 Zookeepers.
trans-unit.target: Each HDInsight cluster has 3 Zookeepers.

trans-unit.source: They are zookeeper0, zookeeper1, and zookeeper2.
trans-unit.target: They are zookeeper0, zookeeper1, and zookeeper2.

trans-unit.source: The FQDN will be something like zookeeper2.myhbasecluster.f5.internal.cloudapp.net.
trans-unit.target: The FQDN will be something like zookeeper2.myhbasecluster.f5.internal.cloudapp.net.

trans-unit.source: To use SQLLine
trans-unit.target: To use SQLLine

trans-unit.source: Open Hadoop Command Line from the desktop.
trans-unit.target: Open Hadoop Command Line from the desktop.

trans-unit.source: Run the following commands to open SQLLine:
trans-unit.target: Run the following commands to open SQLLine:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>hdinsight hbase phoenix sqlline</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>hdinsight hbase phoenix sqlline</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The commands used in the sample:
trans-unit.target: The commands used in the sample:

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>SQLLine manual</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Phoenix Grammar</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>SQLLine manual</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Phoenix Grammar</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SQuirreL SQL Client</linkText><title></title> is a graphical Java program that will allow you to view the structure of a JDBC compliant database, browse the data in tables, issue SQL commands etc. It can be used to connect to Apache Phoenix on HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SQuirreL SQL Client</linkText><title></title> is a graphical Java program that will allow you to view the structure of a JDBC compliant database, browse the data in tables, issue SQL commands etc. It can be used to connect to Apache Phoenix on HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: This section shows you how to install and configure SQuirreL on your workstation to connect to an HBase cluster in HDInsight via VPN.
trans-unit.target: This section shows you how to install and configure SQuirreL on your workstation to connect to an HBase cluster in HDInsight via VPN.

trans-unit.source: Before following the procedures, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before following the procedures, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: An HBase cluster deployed to an Azure virtual network with a DNS virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: An HBase cluster deployed to an Azure virtual network with a DNS virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see <linkText>Provision HBase clusters on Azure Virtual Network[hdinsight-hbase-provision-vnet]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see <linkText>Provision HBase clusters on Azure Virtual Network[hdinsight-hbase-provision-vnet]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You must install a DNS server to the virtual network.
trans-unit.target: You must install a DNS server to the virtual network.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see <linkText>Configure DNS between two Azure virtual networks</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see <linkText>Configure DNS between two Azure virtual networks</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Get the HBase cluster cluster Connection-specific DNS suffix.
trans-unit.target: Get the HBase cluster cluster Connection-specific DNS suffix.

trans-unit.source: To get it, RDP into the cluster, and then run IPConfig.
trans-unit.target: To get it, RDP into the cluster, and then run IPConfig.

trans-unit.source: The DNS suffix is similar to:
trans-unit.target: The DNS suffix is similar to:

trans-unit.source: Download and install <linkText>Microsoft Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows Desktop</linkText><title></title> on your workstation.
trans-unit.target: Download and install <linkText>Microsoft Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows Desktop</linkText><title></title> on your workstation.

trans-unit.source: You will need makecert from the package to create your certificate.
trans-unit.target: You will need makecert from the package to create your certificate.

trans-unit.source: Download and install <linkText>Java Runtime Environment</linkText><title></title> on your workstation.
trans-unit.target: Download and install <linkText>Java Runtime Environment</linkText><title></title> on your workstation.

trans-unit.source: SQuirreL SQL client version 3.0 and higher requires JRE version 1.6 or higher.
trans-unit.target: SQuirreL SQL client version 3.0 and higher requires JRE version 1.6 or higher.

trans-unit.source: There are 3 steps involved configuring a point-to-site VPN connection:
trans-unit.target: There are 3 steps involved configuring a point-to-site VPN connection:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure a virtual network and a dynamic routing gateway</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure a virtual network and a dynamic routing gateway</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create your certificates</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create your certificates</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure your VPN client</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure your VPN client</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Configure a Point-to-Site VPN connection to an Azure Virtual Network</linkText><title></title> for more information.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Configure a Point-to-Site VPN connection to an Azure Virtual Network</linkText><title></title> for more information.

trans-unit.source: Assure you have provisioned an HBase cluster in an Azure virtual network (see the prerequisites for this section).
trans-unit.target: Assure you have provisioned an HBase cluster in an Azure virtual network (see the prerequisites for this section).

trans-unit.source: The next step is to configure a point-to-site connection.
trans-unit.target: The next step is to configure a point-to-site connection.

trans-unit.source: To configure the point-to-site connectivity
trans-unit.target: To configure the point-to-site connectivity

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <linkText>Azure portal[azure-portal]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <linkText>Azure portal[azure-portal]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: On the left, click NETWORKS.
trans-unit.target: On the left, click NETWORKS.

trans-unit.source: Click the virtual network you have created (see <linkText>Provision HBase clusters on Azure Virtual Network[hdinsight-hbase-provision-vnet]</linkText><title></title>).
trans-unit.target: Click the virtual network you have created (see <linkText>Provision HBase clusters on Azure Virtual Network[hdinsight-hbase-provision-vnet]</linkText><title></title>).

trans-unit.source: Click CONFIGURE from the top.
trans-unit.target: Click CONFIGURE from the top.

trans-unit.source: In the point-to-site connectivity section, select Configure point-to-site connectivity.
trans-unit.target: In the point-to-site connectivity section, select Configure point-to-site connectivity.

trans-unit.source: Configure STARTING IP and CIDR to specify the IP address range from which your VPN clients will receive an IP address when connected.
trans-unit.target: Configure STARTING IP and CIDR to specify the IP address range from which your VPN clients will receive an IP address when connected.

trans-unit.source: The range cannot overlap with any of the ranges located on your on-premises network and the Azure virtual network you will be connecting to.
trans-unit.target: The range cannot overlap with any of the ranges located on your on-premises network and the Azure virtual network you will be connecting to.

trans-unit.source: For example.
trans-unit.target: For example.

trans-unit.source: if you selected 10.0.0.0/20 for the virtual network, you can select 10.1.0.0/24 for the client address space.
trans-unit.target: if you selected 10.0.0.0/20 for the virtual network, you can select 10.1.0.0/24 for the client address space.

trans-unit.source: See the <linkText>Point-To-Site Connectivity[vnet-point-to-site-connectivity]</linkText><title></title> page for more information.
trans-unit.target: See the <linkText>Point-To-Site Connectivity[vnet-point-to-site-connectivity]</linkText><title></title> page for more information.

trans-unit.source: In the virtual network address spaces section, click add gateway subnet.
trans-unit.target: In the virtual network address spaces section, click add gateway subnet.

trans-unit.source: Click SAVE on the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click SAVE on the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Click YES to confirm the change.
trans-unit.target: Click YES to confirm the change.

trans-unit.source: Wait until the system has finished making the change before you proceed to the next procedure.
trans-unit.target: Wait until the system has finished making the change before you proceed to the next procedure.

trans-unit.source: To create a dynamic routing gateway
trans-unit.target: To create a dynamic routing gateway

trans-unit.source: From the Azure portal, click DASHBOARD from the top of the page.
trans-unit.target: From the Azure portal, click DASHBOARD from the top of the page.

trans-unit.source: Click CREATE GATEWAY from the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click CREATE GATEWAY from the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Click YES to confirm.
trans-unit.target: Click YES to confirm.

trans-unit.source: Wait until the gateway is created.
trans-unit.target: Wait until the gateway is created.

trans-unit.source: Click DASHBOARD from the top.
trans-unit.target: Click DASHBOARD from the top.

trans-unit.source: You will see a visual diagram of the virtual network:
trans-unit.target: You will see a visual diagram of the virtual network:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure virtual network point-to-site virtual diagram</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure virtual network point-to-site virtual diagram</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The diagram shows 0 client connections.
trans-unit.target: The diagram shows 0 client connections.

trans-unit.source: After you make a connection to the virtual network, the number will be updated to one.
trans-unit.target: After you make a connection to the virtual network, the number will be updated to one.

trans-unit.source: One way to create an X.509 certificate is by using the Certificate Creation Tool (makecert.exe) that comes with <linkText>Microsoft Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows Desktop</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: One way to create an X.509 certificate is by using the Certificate Creation Tool (makecert.exe) that comes with <linkText>Microsoft Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows Desktop</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To create a self-signed root certificate
trans-unit.target: To create a self-signed root certificate

trans-unit.source: From your workstation, open a command prompt window.
trans-unit.target: From your workstation, open a command prompt window.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the Visual Studio tools folder.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the Visual Studio tools folder.

trans-unit.source: The following command in the example below will create and install a root certificate in the Personal certificate store on your workstation and also create a corresponding .cer file that you’ll later upload to the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: The following command in the example below will create and install a root certificate in the Personal certificate store on your workstation and also create a corresponding .cer file that you’ll later upload to the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Change to the directory that you want the .cer file to be located in, where HBaseVnetVPNRootCertificate is the name that you want to use for the certificate.
trans-unit.target: Change to the directory that you want the .cer file to be located in, where HBaseVnetVPNRootCertificate is the name that you want to use for the certificate.

trans-unit.source: Don't close the command prompt.
trans-unit.target: Don't close the command prompt.

trans-unit.source: You will need it in the next procedure.
trans-unit.target: You will need it in the next procedure.

trans-unit.source: Because you have created a root certificate from which client certificates will be generated, you may want to export this certificate along with its private key and save it to a safe location where it may be recovered.
trans-unit.target: Because you have created a root certificate from which client certificates will be generated, you may want to export this certificate along with its private key and save it to a safe location where it may be recovered.

trans-unit.source: To create a client certificate
trans-unit.target: To create a client certificate

trans-unit.source: From the same command prompt (It has to be on the same computer where you created the root certificate.
trans-unit.target: From the same command prompt (It has to be on the same computer where you created the root certificate.

trans-unit.source: The client certificate must be generated from the root certificate), run the following command:
trans-unit.target: The client certificate must be generated from the root certificate), run the following command:

trans-unit.source: HBaseVnetVPNRootCertificate is the root certificate name.
trans-unit.target: HBaseVnetVPNRootCertificate is the root certificate name.

trans-unit.source: It has to match the root certificate name.
trans-unit.target: It has to match the root certificate name.

trans-unit.source: Both the root certificate and the client certificate are stored in your Personal certificate store on your computer.
trans-unit.target: Both the root certificate and the client certificate are stored in your Personal certificate store on your computer.

trans-unit.source: Use certmgr.msc to verify.
trans-unit.target: Use certmgr.msc to verify.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure virtual network point-to-site vpn certificate</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure virtual network point-to-site vpn certificate</linkText>

trans-unit.source: A client certificate must be installed on each computer that you want to connect to the virtual network.
trans-unit.target: A client certificate must be installed on each computer that you want to connect to the virtual network.

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you create unique client certificates for each computer that you want to connect to the virtual network.
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you create unique client certificates for each computer that you want to connect to the virtual network.

trans-unit.source: To export the client certificates, use certmgr.msc.
trans-unit.target: To export the client certificates, use certmgr.msc.

trans-unit.source: To upload the root certificate to the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: To upload the root certificate to the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: From the Azure portal, click NETWORK on the left.
trans-unit.target: From the Azure portal, click NETWORK on the left.

trans-unit.source: Click the virtual network where your HBase cluster is deployed to.
trans-unit.target: Click the virtual network where your HBase cluster is deployed to.

trans-unit.source: Click CERTIFICATES from the top.
trans-unit.target: Click CERTIFICATES from the top.

trans-unit.source: Click UPLOAD from the bottom, and specify the root certificate file you have created in the procedure before last.
trans-unit.target: Click UPLOAD from the bottom, and specify the root certificate file you have created in the procedure before last.

trans-unit.source: Wait until the certificate got imported.
trans-unit.target: Wait until the certificate got imported.

trans-unit.source: Click DASHBOARD on the top.
trans-unit.target: Click DASHBOARD on the top.

trans-unit.source: The virtual diagram shows the status.
trans-unit.target: The virtual diagram shows the status.

trans-unit.source: To download and install the client VPN package
trans-unit.target: To download and install the client VPN package

trans-unit.source: From the DASHBOARD page of the virtual network, in the quick glance section, click either Download the 64-bit Client VPN Package or Download the 32-bit Client VPN Package based on your workstation OS version.
trans-unit.target: From the DASHBOARD page of the virtual network, in the quick glance section, click either Download the 64-bit Client VPN Package or Download the 32-bit Client VPN Package based on your workstation OS version.

trans-unit.source: Click Run to install the package.
trans-unit.target: Click Run to install the package.

trans-unit.source: At the security prompt, click More info, and then click Run anyway.
trans-unit.target: At the security prompt, click More info, and then click Run anyway.

trans-unit.source: Click Yes twice.
trans-unit.target: Click Yes twice.

trans-unit.source: To connect to VPN
trans-unit.target: To connect to VPN

trans-unit.source: On the desktop of your workstation, click the Networks icon on the Task bar.
trans-unit.target: On the desktop of your workstation, click the Networks icon on the Task bar.

trans-unit.source: You shall see a VPN connection with your virtual network name.
trans-unit.target: You shall see a VPN connection with your virtual network name.

trans-unit.source: Click the VPN connection name.
trans-unit.target: Click the VPN connection name.

trans-unit.source: Click Connect.
trans-unit.target: Click Connect.

trans-unit.source: To test the VPN connection and domain name resolution
trans-unit.target: To test the VPN connection and domain name resolution

trans-unit.source: From the workstation, open a command prompt and ping one of the following names given the HBase cluster's DNS suffix is myhbase.b7.internal.cloudapp.net:
trans-unit.target: From the workstation, open a command prompt and ping one of the following names given the HBase cluster's DNS suffix is myhbase.b7.internal.cloudapp.net:

trans-unit.source: To install SQuirreL
trans-unit.target: To install SQuirreL

trans-unit.source: Download the SQuirreL SQL client jar file from <linkText>http://squirrel-sql.sourceforge.net/#installation</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Download the SQuirreL SQL client jar file from <linkText>http://squirrel-sql.sourceforge.net/#installation</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Open/run the jar file.
trans-unit.target: Open/run the jar file.

trans-unit.source: It requires the <linkText>Java Runtime Environment</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: It requires the <linkText>Java Runtime Environment</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Click Next twice.
trans-unit.target: Click Next twice.

trans-unit.source: Specify a path where you have the write permission, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: Specify a path where you have the write permission, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: The default installation folder is in the C:\Program Files\squirrel-sql-3.6 folder.
trans-unit.target: The default installation folder is in the C:\Program Files\squirrel-sql-3.6 folder.

trans-unit.source: In order to write to this path, the installer must be granted the administrator privilege.
trans-unit.target: In order to write to this path, the installer must be granted the administrator privilege.

trans-unit.source: You can open a command prompt as administrator, navigate to Java's bin folder, and then run
trans-unit.target: You can open a command prompt as administrator, navigate to Java's bin folder, and then run

trans-unit.source: Click OK to confirm creating the target directory.
trans-unit.target: Click OK to confirm creating the target directory.

trans-unit.source: The default setting is to install the Base and Standard packages.
trans-unit.target: The default setting is to install the Base and Standard packages.

trans-unit.source: Click Next.
trans-unit.target: Click Next.

trans-unit.source: Click Next twice, and then click Done.
trans-unit.target: Click Next twice, and then click Done.

trans-unit.source: To install the Phoenix driver
trans-unit.target: To install the Phoenix driver

trans-unit.source: The phoenix driver jar file is located on the HBase cluster.
trans-unit.target: The phoenix driver jar file is located on the HBase cluster.

trans-unit.source: The path is similar to the following based on the versions:
trans-unit.target: The path is similar to the following based on the versions:

trans-unit.source: To add a Phoenix driver to SQuirreL
trans-unit.target: To add a Phoenix driver to SQuirreL

trans-unit.source: Open SQuirreL SQL Client from your workstation.
trans-unit.target: Open SQuirreL SQL Client from your workstation.

trans-unit.source: Click the Driver tab on the left.
trans-unit.target: Click the Driver tab on the left.

trans-unit.source: From the Drivers menu, click New Driver.
trans-unit.target: From the Drivers menu, click New Driver.

trans-unit.source: Enter the following information:
trans-unit.target: Enter the following information:

trans-unit.source: Name: Phoenix
trans-unit.target: Name: Phoenix

trans-unit.source: Example URL: jdbc:phoenix:zookeeper2.contoso-hbase-eu.f5.internal.cloudapp.net
trans-unit.target: Example URL: jdbc:phoenix:zookeeper2.contoso-hbase-eu.f5.internal.cloudapp.net

trans-unit.source: Class Name: org.apache.phoenix.jdbc.PhoenixDriver
trans-unit.target: Class Name: org.apache.phoenix.jdbc.PhoenixDriver

trans-unit.source: User all lower case in the Example URL.
trans-unit.target: User all lower case in the Example URL.

trans-unit.source: You can use they full zookeeper quorum in case one of them is down.
trans-unit.target: You can use they full zookeeper quorum in case one of them is down.

trans-unit.source: The hostnames are zookeeper0, zookeeper1, and zookeeper2.
trans-unit.target: The hostnames are zookeeper0, zookeeper1, and zookeeper2.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>HDInsight HBase Phoenix SQuirreL driver</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>HDInsight HBase Phoenix SQuirreL driver</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click OK.
trans-unit.target: Click OK.

trans-unit.source: To create an alias to the HBase cluster
trans-unit.target: To create an alias to the HBase cluster

trans-unit.source: From SQuirreL, Click the Aliases tab on the left.
trans-unit.target: From SQuirreL, Click the Aliases tab on the left.

trans-unit.source: From the Aliases menu, click New Alias.
trans-unit.target: From the Aliases menu, click New Alias.

trans-unit.source: Enter the following information:
trans-unit.target: Enter the following information:

trans-unit.source: Name: The name of the HBase cluster or any name you prefer.
trans-unit.target: Name: The name of the HBase cluster or any name you prefer.

trans-unit.source: Driver: Phoenix.
trans-unit.target: Driver: Phoenix.

trans-unit.source: This must match the driver name you created in the last procedure.
trans-unit.target: This must match the driver name you created in the last procedure.

trans-unit.source: URL: The URL is copied from your driver configuration.
trans-unit.target: URL: The URL is copied from your driver configuration.

trans-unit.source: Make sure to user all lower case.
trans-unit.target: Make sure to user all lower case.

trans-unit.source: User name: It can be any text.
trans-unit.target: User name: It can be any text.

trans-unit.source: Because you use VPN connectivity here, the user name is not used at all.
trans-unit.target: Because you use VPN connectivity here, the user name is not used at all.

trans-unit.source: Password: It can be any text.
trans-unit.target: Password: It can be any text.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>HDInsight HBase Phoenix SQuirreL driver</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>HDInsight HBase Phoenix SQuirreL driver</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Test.
trans-unit.target: Click Test.

trans-unit.source: Click Connect.
trans-unit.target: Click Connect.

trans-unit.source: When it makes the connection, SQuirreL looks like:
trans-unit.target: When it makes the connection, SQuirreL looks like:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>HBase Phoenix SQuirreL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>HBase Phoenix SQuirreL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To run a test
trans-unit.target: To run a test

trans-unit.source: Click the SQL tab right next to the Objects tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the SQL tab right next to the Objects tab.

trans-unit.source: Copy and paste the following code:
trans-unit.target: Copy and paste the following code:

trans-unit.source: Click the run button.
trans-unit.target: Click the run button.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>HBase Phoenix SQuirreL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>HBase Phoenix SQuirreL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Switch back to the Objects tab.
trans-unit.target: Switch back to the Objects tab.

trans-unit.source: Expand the alias name, and then expand TABLE.
trans-unit.target: Expand the alias name, and then expand TABLE.

trans-unit.source: You shall see the new table listed under.
trans-unit.target: You shall see the new table listed under.

trans-unit.source: In this article, you have learned how to use Apache Phoenix in HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: In this article, you have learned how to use Apache Phoenix in HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: To learn more, see
trans-unit.target: To learn more, see

trans-unit.source: <linkText>HDInsight HBase overview[hdinsight-hbase-overview]</linkText><title></title>: HBase is an Apache, open-source, NoSQL database built on Hadoop that provides random access and strong consistency for large amounts of unstructured and semistructured data.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>HDInsight HBase overview[hdinsight-hbase-overview]</linkText><title></title>: HBase is an Apache, open-source, NoSQL database built on Hadoop that provides random access and strong consistency for large amounts of unstructured and semistructured data.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Provision HBase clusters on Azure Virtual Network[hdinsight-hbase-provision-vnet]</linkText><title></title>: With virtual network integration, HBase clusters can be deployed to the same virtual network as your applications so that applications can communicate with HBase directly.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Provision HBase clusters on Azure Virtual Network[hdinsight-hbase-provision-vnet]</linkText><title></title>: With virtual network integration, HBase clusters can be deployed to the same virtual network as your applications so that applications can communicate with HBase directly.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure HBase replication in HDInsight</linkText><title></title>: Learn how to configure HBase replication across two Azure datacenters.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure HBase replication in HDInsight</linkText><title></title>: Learn how to configure HBase replication across two Azure datacenters.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Analyze Twitter sentiment with HBase in HDInsight[hbase-twitter-sentiment]</linkText><title></title>: Learn how to do real-time <linkText>sentiment analysis</linkText><title></title> of big data by using HBase in a Hadoop cluster in HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Analyze Twitter sentiment with HBase in HDInsight[hbase-twitter-sentiment]</linkText><title></title>: Learn how to do real-time <linkText>sentiment analysis</linkText><title></title> of big data by using HBase in a Hadoop cluster in HDInsight.
